messages.title: David Blunkett's pledge
messages.content: My pledge to you is to put your voice first. My task is to work for you, locally and nationally, and to be rooted in the community. I will continue to work with local and national charities, regenerate business, and to protect Sheffield and UK companies.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pledges for kids who are falling behind in the basics
Implementing a points-based system to control immigration

keyPolicies.policyTitle: 1 million new skilled jobs and a rising Minimum Wage
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises 1 million new skilled jobs and a rising Minimum Wage

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Dignity in old age with a National Care Service
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring dignity in old age with a National Care Service

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect the Post Office with a People's Bank
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protection of the Post Office with a People's Bank

issues.immigration: LABOUR'S NATIONAL PLEDGES - A points-based system to control immigration

housing.content: Labour's Decent Homes Programme has seen improvements in over 40,000 Sheffield homes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I will continue to work with local and national charities, regenerate business, and to protect Sheffield and UK companies.

politicalExperience.role: Secretary of State for Work and Pensions

quotes.text: The only way to continue the improvements we've seen in our local area over the last 13 years is to vote Labour in both the local and general elections.

images.caption: David Blunkett with the Friends of Burngreave Cemetery.
Home Secretary Alan Johnson with David Blunkett in Burngreave.
